config_description: Defensive settings for protecting Cassandra from true network partitions. See (CASSANDRA-14358) for details.  The amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' is used to determine the amount of time to wait for internode TCP connections to establish in the system. The method tcpConnectTimeoutInMS() checks if the configuration value is set, and if not, it retrieves the value from DatabaseDescriptor.getInternodeTcpConnectTimeoutInMS().
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' configuration depends on the specific use case and workload of the system. It is typically triggered when establishing internode TCP connections in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' configuration option on the system is related to the time it takes to establish internode TCP connections. Setting this configuration too low may result in failed connections, while setting it too high may introduce delays in communication between nodes.
